verses.verse: Hear <S%H238><s%> my teaching, <S%H8451><s%> my people. <S%H5971><s%> Turn <S%H5186><s%> your ears <S%H241><s%> to the words <S%H561><s%> of my mouth. <S%H6310><s%>
I will open <S%H6605><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%> in a parable. <S%H4912><s%> I will utter <S%H5042><s%> dark sayings <S%H2420><s%> of old, <S%H6924><s%>
Which we have heard <S%H8085><s%> and known, <S%H3045><s%> and our fathers <S%H1><s%> have told us. <S%H5608><s%>

We will not hide <S%H3582><s%> them from their children, <S%H1121><s%> telling <S%H5608><s%> to the generation <S%H1755><s%> to come <S%H314><s%> the praises <S%H8416><s%> of Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> his strength, <S%H5807><s%> and his wondrous works <S%H6381><s%> that he has done. <S%H6213><s%>

For he established <S%H6965><s%> a testimony <S%H5715><s%> in Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and appointed <S%H7760><s%> a teaching <S%H8451><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> which he commanded <S%H6680><s%> our fathers, <S%H1><s%> that they should make them known <S%H3045><s%> to their children; <S%H1121><s%>

that the generation <S%H1755><s%> to come <S%H314><s%> might know, <S%H3045><s%> even the children <S%H1121><s%> who should be born; <S%H3205><s%> who should arise <S%H6965><s%> and tell <S%H5608><s%> their children, <S%H1121><s%>

that they might set <S%H7760><s%> their hope <S%H3689><s%> in God, <S%H430><s%> and not forget <S%H7911><s%> the works <S%H4611><s%> of God, <S%H410><s%> but keep <S%H5341><s%> his commandments, <S%H4687><s%>

and might not be as their fathers, <S%H1><s%> a stubborn <S%H5637><s%> and rebellious <S%H4784><s%> generation, <S%H1755><s%> a generation <S%H1755><s%> that didn't <S%H3559><s%> make their hearts <S%H3820><s%> loyal, <S%H3559><s%> whose spirit <S%H7307><s%> was not steadfast <S%H539><s%> with God. <S%H410><s%>

The children <S%H1121><s%> of Ephraim, <S%H669><s%> being armed <S%H5401><s%> and carrying <S%H7411><s%> bows, <S%H7198><s%> turned back <S%H2015><s%> in the day <S%H3117><s%> of battle. <S%H7128><s%>
They didn't <S%H8104><s%> keep God <S%H430><s%>'s covenant, <S%H1285><s%> and refused <S%H3985><s%> to walk <S%H3212><s%> in his law. <S%H8451><s%>
They forgot <S%H7911><s%> his doings, <S%H5949><s%> his wondrous works <S%H5949><s%> that he had shown them. <S%H7200><s%>

He did <S%H6213><s%> marvelous things <S%H6382><s%> in the sight <S%H5048><s%> of their fathers, <S%H1><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%> of Zoan. <S%H6814><s%>
He split <S%H1234><s%> the sea, <S%H3220><s%> and caused them to pass through. <S%H5674><s%> He made the waters <S%H4325><s%> stand <S%H5324><s%> as a heap. <S%H5067><s%>
In the daytime <S%H3119><s%> he also led <S%H5148><s%> them with a cloud, <S%H6051><s%> and all night <S%H3915><s%> with a light <S%H216><s%> of fire. <S%H784><s%>
He split <S%H1234><s%> rocks <S%H6697><s%> in the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> and gave them drink <S%H8248><s%> abundantly as out of the <S%H7227><s%> depths. <S%H8415><s%>
He brought <S%H3318><s%> streams <S%H5140><s%> also out of the rock, <S%H5553><s%> and caused waters <S%H4325><s%> to run down <S%H3381><s%> like rivers. <S%H5104><s%>
Yet they still <S%H3254><s%> went on to sin <S%H2398><s%> against him, <S%H4784><s%> to rebel against the Most High <S%H5945><s%> in the desert. <S%H6723><s%>
They tempted <S%H5254><s%> God <S%H410><s%> in their heart <S%H3824><s%> by asking <S%H7592><s%> food <S%H400><s%> according to their desire. <S%H5315><s%>
Yes, <S%H1696><s%> they spoke against God. <S%H430><s%> They said, <S%H1696><s%> "Can <S%H3201><s%> God <S%H410><s%> prepare <S%H6186><s%> a table <S%H7979><s%> in the wilderness? <S%H4057><s%>

Behold, <S%H5221><s%> he struck the rock, <S%H6697><s%> so that waters <S%H4325><s%> gushed out, <S%H2100><s%> and streams <S%H5158><s%> overflowed. <S%H7857><s%> Can <S%H3201><s%> he give <S%H5414><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> also? <S%H3201><s%> Will he provide <S%H3559><s%> flesh <S%H7607><s%> for his people? <S%H5971><s%>"

Therefore Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> heard, <S%H8085><s%> and was angry. <S%H5674><s%> A fire <S%H784><s%> was kindled <S%H5400><s%> against Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> anger <S%H639><s%> also went up <S%H5927><s%> against Israel, <S%H3478><s%>
because they didn't <S%H539><s%> believe in God, <S%H430><s%> and didn't <S%H982><s%> trust in his salvation. <S%H3444><s%>
Yet he commanded <S%H6680><s%> the skies <S%H7834><s%> above, <S%H4605><s%> and opened <S%H6605><s%> the doors <S%H1817><s%> of heaven. <S%H8064><s%>
He rained down <S%H4305><s%> manna <S%H4478><s%> on them to eat, <S%H398><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> them food <S%H1715><s%> from the sky. <S%H8064><s%>
Man <S%H376><s%> ate <S%H398><s%> the bread <S%H3899><s%> of angels. <S%H47><s%> He sent <S%H7971><s%> them food <S%H3899><s%> to the full. <S%H7648><s%>
He caused the east wind <S%H6921><s%> to blow <S%H5265><s%> in the sky. <S%H8064><s%> By his power <S%H5797><s%> he guided <S%H5090><s%> the south wind. <S%H8486><s%>
He rained <S%H4305><s%> also flesh <S%H7607><s%> on them as the dust; <S%H6083><s%> winged <S%H3671><s%> birds <S%H5775><s%> as the sand <S%H2344><s%> of the seas. <S%H3220><s%>
He let them fall <S%H5307><s%> in the midst <S%H7130><s%> of their camp, <S%H4264><s%> around <S%H5439><s%> their habitations. <S%H4908><s%>
So they ate, <S%H398><s%> and were well <S%H3966><s%> filled. <S%H7646><s%> He gave <S%H935><s%> them their own desire. <S%H8378><s%>
They didn't <S%H2114><s%> turn from their cravings. <S%H8378><s%> Their food <S%H400><s%> was yet in their mouths, <S%H6310><s%>

when the anger <S%H639><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> went <S%H5927><s%> up against them, <S%H2026><s%> killed some of their fattest, <S%H4924><s%> and struck down <S%H3766><s%> the young <S%H970><s%> men of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
For all this they still sinned, <S%H2398><s%> and didn't <S%H539><s%> believe in his wondrous works. <S%H6381><s%>
Therefore he consumed <S%H3615><s%> their days <S%H3117><s%> in vanity, <S%H1892><s%> and their years <S%H8141><s%> in terror. <S%H928><s%>
When he killed <S%H2026><s%> them, <S%H1875><s%> then they inquired after him. <S%H7725><s%> They returned and sought God <S%H410><s%> earnestly. <S%H7836><s%>
They remembered <S%H2142><s%> that God <S%H430><s%> was their rock, <S%H6697><s%> the Most High <S%H5945><s%> God, <S%H410><s%> their redeemer. <S%H1350><s%>
But they flattered <S%H6601><s%> him with their mouth, <S%H6310><s%> and lied <S%H3576><s%> to him with their tongue. <S%H3956><s%>
For their heart <S%H3820><s%> was not right <S%H3559><s%> with him, <S%H539><s%> neither were they faithful in his covenant. <S%H1285><s%>

But he, <S%H7349><s%> being merciful, forgave <S%H3722><s%> iniquity, <S%H5771><s%> and didn't <S%H7843><s%> destroy them. <S%H7235><s%> Yes, many times he turned <S%H7725><s%> his anger <S%H639><s%> away, <S%H7725><s%> and didn't <S%H5782><s%> stir up all his wrath. <S%H2534><s%>
He remembered <S%H2142><s%> that they were but flesh, <S%H1320><s%> a wind <S%H7307><s%> that passes away, <S%H1980><s%> and doesn't <S%H7725><s%> come again.
How <S%H4100><s%> often they rebelled <S%H4784><s%> against him in the wilderness, <S%H4057><s%> and grieved <S%H6087><s%> him in the desert! <S%H3452><s%>
They turned <S%H7725><s%> again and tempted <S%H5254><s%> God, <S%H410><s%> and provoked <S%H8428><s%> the Holy One <S%H6918><s%> of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>
They didn't <S%H2142><s%> remember his hand, <S%H3027><s%> nor the day <S%H3117><s%> when he redeemed <S%H6299><s%> them from the adversary; <S%H6862><s%>
how he set <S%H7760><s%> his signs <S%H226><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> his wonders <S%H226><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%> of Zoan, <S%H6814><s%>
he turned <S%H2015><s%> their rivers <S%H2975><s%> into blood, <S%H1818><s%> and their streams, <S%H2975><s%> so that they could not drink. <S%H8354><s%>
He sent <S%H7971><s%> among them swarms of flies, <S%H6157><s%> which devoured <S%H398><s%> them; <S%H6854><s%> and frogs, which destroyed them. <S%H7843><s%>
He gave <S%H5414><s%> also their increase <S%H2981><s%> to the caterpillar, <S%H2625><s%> and their labor <S%H3018><s%> to the locust. <S%H697><s%>
He destroyed <S%H2026><s%> their vines <S%H1612><s%> with hail, <S%H1259><s%> their sycamore fig trees <S%H8256><s%> with frost. <S%H2602><s%>
He gave over <S%H5462><s%> their livestock <S%H1165><s%> also to the hail, <S%H1259><s%> and their flocks <S%H4735><s%> to hot thunderbolts. <S%H7565><s%>

He threw <S%H7971><s%> on them the fierceness <S%H2740><s%> of his anger, <S%H639><s%> wrath, <S%H5678><s%> indignation, <S%H2195><s%> and trouble, <S%H6869><s%> and a band <S%H4917><s%> of angels <S%H4397><s%> of evil. <S%H7451><s%>

He made <S%H6424><s%> a path <S%H5410><s%> for his anger. <S%H639><s%> He didn't <S%H2820><s%> spare their soul <S%H5315><s%> from death, <S%H4194><s%> but gave <S%H5462><s%> their life <S%H2416><s%> over <S%H5462><s%> to the pestilence, <S%H1698><s%>
and struck <S%H5221><s%> all the firstborn <S%H1060><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> the chief <S%H7225><s%> of their strength <S%H202><s%> in the tents <S%H168><s%> of Ham. <S%H2526><s%>
But he led forth <S%H5265><s%> his own people <S%H5971><s%> like sheep, <S%H6629><s%> and guided <S%H5090><s%> them in the wilderness <S%H4057><s%> like a flock. <S%H5739><s%>
He led <S%H5148><s%> them safely, <S%H983><s%> so that they weren't <S%H6342><s%> afraid, but the sea <S%H3220><s%> overwhelmed <S%H3680><s%> their enemies. <S%H341><s%>
He brought <S%H935><s%> them to the border <S%H1366><s%> of his sanctuary, <S%H6944><s%> to this mountain, <S%H2022><s%> which his right hand <S%H3225><s%> had taken. <S%H7069><s%>

He also drove out <S%H1644><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> them, <S%H5307><s%> allotted them for an inheritance <S%H5159><s%> by line, <S%H2256><s%> and made the tribes <S%H7626><s%> of Israel <S%H3478><s%> to dwell <S%H7931><s%> in their tents. <S%H168><s%>
Yet they tempted <S%H5254><s%> and rebelled <S%H4784><s%> against the Most High <S%H5945><s%> God, <S%H430><s%> and didn't <S%H8104><s%> keep his testimonies; <S%H5713><s%>
but turned back, <S%H5472><s%> and dealt treacherously <S%H898><s%> like their fathers. <S%H1><s%> They were turned aside <S%H2015><s%> like a deceitful <S%H7423><s%> bow. <S%H7198><s%>
For they provoked him to anger <S%H3707><s%> with their high places, <S%H1116><s%> and moved him to jealousy <S%H7065><s%> with their engraved images. <S%H6456><s%>
When God <S%H430><s%> heard <S%H8085><s%> this, <S%H5674><s%> he was angry, and greatly <S%H3966><s%> abhorred <S%H3988><s%> Israel; <S%H3478><s%>
So that he forsook <S%H5203><s%> the tent <S%H4908><s%> of Shiloh, <S%H7887><s%> the tent <S%H4908><s%> which he placed <S%H7931><s%> among men; <S%H120><s%>
and delivered <S%H5414><s%> his strength <S%H5797><s%> into captivity, <S%H7628><s%> his glory <S%H8597><s%> into the adversary <S%H6862><s%>'s hand. <S%H3027><s%>
He also gave <S%H5462><s%> his people <S%H5971><s%> over <S%H5462><s%> to the sword, <S%H2719><s%> and was angry <S%H5674><s%> with his inheritance. <S%H5159><s%>
Fire <S%H784><s%> devoured <S%H398><s%> their young men. <S%H970><s%> Their virgins <S%H1330><s%> had no wedding song. <S%H1984><s%>
Their priests <S%H3548><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> by the sword, <S%H2719><s%> and their widows <S%H490><s%> couldn't <S%H1058><s%> weep.
Then the Lord <S%H136><s%> awakened <S%H3364><s%> as one out of sleep, <S%H3463><s%> like a mighty man <S%H1368><s%> who shouts <S%H7442><s%> by reason of wine. <S%H3196><s%>
He struck <S%H5221><s%> his adversaries <S%H6862><s%> backward. <S%H268><s%> He put <S%H5414><s%> them to a perpetual <S%H5769><s%> reproach. <S%H2781><s%>
Moreover he rejected <S%H3988><s%> the tent <S%H168><s%> of Joseph, <S%H3130><s%> and didn't <S%H977><s%> choose the tribe <S%H7626><s%> of Ephraim, <S%H669><s%>
But chose <S%H977><s%> the tribe <S%H7626><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> Mount <S%H2022><s%> Zion <S%H6726><s%> which he loved. <S%H157><s%>
He built <S%H1129><s%> his sanctuary <S%H4720><s%> like the heights, <S%H7311><s%> like the earth <S%H776><s%> which he has established <S%H3245><s%> forever. <S%H5769><s%>
He also chose <S%H977><s%> David <S%H1732><s%> his servant, <S%H5650><s%> and took <S%H3947><s%> him from the sheepfolds; <S%H4356><s%>

from following <S%H310><s%> the ewes that have their young, <S%H5763><s%> he brought <S%H935><s%> him to be the shepherd <S%H7462><s%> of Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> his people, <S%H5971><s%> and Israel, <S%H3478><s%> his inheritance. <S%H5159><s%>
So he was their shepherd <S%H7462><s%> according to the integrity <S%H8537><s%> of his heart, <S%H3824><s%> and guided <S%H5148><s%> them by the skillfulness <S%H8394><s%> of his hands. <S%H3709><s%>
